page.title: 08BREWERIES OF TADCASTER
page.content: Brewing has been going on in Tadcaster since the 13th century. Records show that there were at least 2 brew houses then,both paying taxes.It was mainly due to the water in Tadcaster.The rock was limestone which made the water hard.When the railways arrived,and coaches were not used very often,Tadcaster was a dying town.But the breweries developed and saved the town.The history of John Smith Tadcaster Brewery dates back to 1758 to a small,some what rundown brewery at one time owned by postmaster John Hartley inn owner David Blackhouse. The breweries are the towns largest industry; and now there are three breweries John Smith's; Bass Charringtons and Samuel Smith's old brewery which makes Tadcaster the third main brewing town in the country
